policies.name: System Maintenance Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing the approval, control, and monitoring of system maintenance tools
policies.rationale: NIST 03.07.04 requires 'approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools' necessitating formal policy guidance

policies.name: Malicious Code Protection Policy
policies.description: Policy requiring inspection of all media for malicious code before use in systems
policies.rationale: Control requires 'check media with diagnostic and test programs for malicious code' which requires policy-level direction

policies.name: CUI Protection Policy
policies.description: Policy governing protection of equipment containing CUI and removal procedures
policies.rationale: Control requires preventing removal of equipment containing CUI through verification, sanitization, or retention procedures

procedures.name: Maintenance Tool Approval Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for requesting, evaluating, approving, and documenting maintenance tools including hardware/software diagnostic equipment, packet sniffers, and test programs
procedures.rationale: Control requires formal approval process; discussion states tools may be pre-installed, brought on media, cloud-based, or downloaded requiring systematic approval

procedures.name: Media Malware Scanning Procedure
procedures.description: Process for scanning diagnostic media and test programs for malicious code using cryptographic hash verification, digital signature validation, and anti-malware scanning before use
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires checking media for malicious code; discussion states diagnostic programs are potential vehicles for transporting malicious code

procedures.name: Maintenance Equipment Removal Procedure
procedures.description: Process for verifying absence of CUI on maintenance equipment before removal, including data verification steps, sanitization methods, and retention protocols
procedures.rationale: Control requires preventing removal of equipment containing CUI through three methods: verification, sanitization, or retention

procedures.name: Maintenance Tool Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review of approved maintenance tools to identify outdated, unsupported, irrelevant, or no-longer-used tools for withdrawal of approval
procedures.rationale: Discussion states periodic review can result in withdrawal of approval for outdated or unsupported tools

executionEvidence.name: Maintenance Tool Approval Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: tool description, business justification, risk assessment, approver name/title, approval date, tool version, deployment method (cloud/media/pre-installed)
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates approval process execution for each maintenance tool as required by control requirement (a)

executionEvidence.name: Media Malware Scan Reports
executionEvidence.description: Scan results showing: media identifier, scan date/time, scanning tool used, cryptographic hash verification results, digital signature validation results, malware scan results, approver signature before use
executionEvidence.frequency: Before each use of diagnostic media
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: Must be current before media use
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (b) explicitly requires checking media before use; discussion emphasizes cryptographic hash and digital signature validation

executionEvidence.name: Equipment Removal Authorization Forms
executionEvidence.description: Forms documenting: equipment description/serial number, CUI verification results, sanitization method used (if applicable), verification signatures, removal authorization, date removed
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (c) requires prevention of CUI removal through verification, sanitization, or retention procedures

executionEvidence.name: Maintenance Tool Monitoring Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: tool name, user, date/time of use, system accessed, purpose of maintenance, duration, supervisor approval (if required)
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires monitoring of maintenance tool use; logs provide audit trail of tool usage patterns

executionEvidence.name: Annual Maintenance Tool Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: inventory of approved tools, tools reviewed, tools marked for withdrawal (outdated/unsupported), new tools needed, reviewer signatures, review completion date
executionEvidence.rationale: Discussion states periodic review can result in withdrawal of approval for outdated/unsupported tools; annual review aligns with industry standards

executionEvidence.name: Malicious Code Incident Reports
executionEvidence.description: Incident reports documenting: malicious code detected on maintenance media, date detected, containment actions, remediation steps, lessons learned per incident response procedures
executionEvidence.rationale: Discussion states if media contains malicious code, incident is handled consistent with incident handling policies

operationalActivities: Submit maintenance tool approval requests with business justification
Review and approve/deny maintenance tool requests based on risk assessment
Scan all diagnostic media and test programs for malicious code before use
Verify cryptographic hash and digital signatures of diagnostic programs
Check maintenance equipment for CUI before allowing removal from facility
Sanitize or retain equipment containing CUI per policy requirements
Log all maintenance tool usage including user, date/time, and purpose
Conduct annual review of approved maintenance tools
Withdraw approval for outdated, unsupported, or no-longer-used tools
Handle malicious code incidents per incident response procedures

policies.name: Remote Access Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing nonlocal/remote maintenance and diagnostic activities
policies.rationale: NIST 03.07.05 requires 'approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities' necessitating policy-level direction

policies.name: Multi-Factor Authentication Policy
policies.description: Policy requiring MFA for nonlocal maintenance sessions with replay resistance mechanisms
policies.rationale: Control requirement (b) explicitly requires implementing multi-factor authentication and replay resistance for nonlocal maintenance sessions

policies.name: Session Management Policy
policies.description: Policy requiring termination of maintenance sessions and network connections upon completion
policies.rationale: Control requirement (c) requires session and network connection termination when nonlocal maintenance is completed

procedures.name: Nonlocal Maintenance Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for requesting, approving, and documenting nonlocal maintenance activities including business justification, risk assessment, and time-limited access
procedures.rationale: Control requires approval of nonlocal maintenance activities; discussion notes authentication techniques reflect requirements in 03.05.01

procedures.name: Remote Maintenance Session Establishment Procedure
procedures.description: Process for establishing secure nonlocal maintenance sessions including MFA verification, replay-resistant authentication mechanisms, secure connection protocols (VPN/encrypted channels)
procedures.rationale: Control requirement (b) requires multi-factor authentication and replay resistance in establishment of nonlocal maintenance sessions

procedures.name: Maintenance Session Monitoring Procedure
procedures.description: Process for real-time monitoring of nonlocal maintenance activities including logging, activity review, and escalation of suspicious activities
procedures.rationale: Control requires monitoring of nonlocal maintenance activities throughout session duration

procedures.name: Session Termination Procedure
procedures.description: Process for properly closing maintenance sessions including connection termination, access revocation, log archival, and completion verification
procedures.rationale: Control requirement (c) explicitly requires termination of session and network connections when maintenance is completed

executionEvidence.name: Nonlocal Maintenance Authorization Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: maintenance request details, requestor/vendor name, systems to be accessed, maintenance window (start/end times), business justification, approver name/title, approval date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (a) requires approval of nonlocal maintenance activities; records demonstrate approval process execution

executionEvidence.name: MFA Authentication Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: user identity, authentication method (MFA factors used), timestamp, authentication success/failure, replay resistance mechanism verification, source IP/location
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (b) requires multi-factor authentication and replay resistance; logs provide proof of MFA usage per session

executionEvidence.name: Nonlocal Maintenance Session Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: session ID, user/vendor, systems accessed, session start time, activities performed, commands executed, files accessed/modified, session duration
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires monitoring of nonlocal maintenance activities; detailed session logs provide audit trail of all activities

executionEvidence.name: Session Termination Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: session ID, termination time, method of termination (automatic/manual), connections closed, access revoked, termination confirmed by username
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (c) requires termination of sessions and network connections; records demonstrate proper termination procedures

executionEvidence.name: Weekly Remote Access Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: nonlocal maintenance sessions conducted, compliance with authorization, unusual activities flagged, MFA compliance verification, session termination verification, reviewer signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: Critical control requires frequent monitoring; weekly reviews align with CIS recommendations for privileged remote access monitoring

executionEvidence.name: Vendor Maintenance Activity Reports
executionEvidence.description: Vendor-provided reports documenting: maintenance performed, issues resolved, changes made, systems accessed, personnel involved, maintenance completion date
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides third-party verification of maintenance activities for audit purposes and monitoring requirement compliance

operationalActivities: Submit nonlocal maintenance requests with business justification and time window
Review and approve/deny nonlocal maintenance requests based on risk
Establish secure remote maintenance sessions using MFA with replay resistance
Monitor nonlocal maintenance sessions in real-time for suspicious activity
Log all commands, file access, and system changes during maintenance sessions
Automatically terminate sessions after authorized maintenance window expires
Manually terminate sessions and revoke access when maintenance completes
Conduct weekly reviews of all nonlocal maintenance activities
Verify MFA compliance for all remote maintenance sessions
Escalate unauthorized or suspicious maintenance activities per incident response

policies.name: Maintenance Personnel Authorization Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy establishing requirements for authorizing maintenance personnel and maintaining lists of authorized organizations/personnel
policies.rationale: NIST 03.07.06 requirements (a) and (b) require establishing authorization processes and maintaining authorized lists which necessitate policy-level direction

policies.name: Access Authorization Policy
policies.description: Policy defining required access authorizations for personnel performing maintenance on systems handling CUI
policies.rationale: Control requirement (c) requires verification that non-escorted personnel possess required access authorizations

policies.name: Temporary Access Policy
policies.description: Policy for issuing temporary credentials to vendor/contractor maintenance personnel based on risk assessment
policies.rationale: Discussion states organizations may choose to issue temporary credentials to manufacturers, consultants, vendors for one-time use or limited time periods based on risk assessments

procedures.name: Maintenance Personnel Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for vetting, authorizing, and documenting maintenance personnel including background check requirements, technical competency verification, access level determination
procedures.rationale: Control requirement (a) requires establishing a process for maintenance personnel authorization

procedures.name: Authorized Maintenance Organization/Personnel List Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for creating, updating, and maintaining the list of authorized maintenance organizations and individual personnel including periodic review and removal of inactive personnel
procedures.rationale: Control requirement (b) explicitly requires maintaining a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel

procedures.name: Non-Escorted Maintenance Verification Procedure
procedures.description: Process for verifying that non-escorted maintenance personnel possess required access authorizations before granting system access, including credential verification and authorization confirmation
procedures.rationale: Control requirement (c) requires verification that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance possess required access authorizations

procedures.name: Escorted Maintenance Supervision Procedure
procedures.description: Process for designating qualified supervisors with appropriate authorizations and technical competence to oversee maintenance personnel who lack required authorizations
procedures.rationale: Control requirement (d) requires designating organizational personnel with authorizations and technical competence to supervise maintenance activities

procedures.name: Temporary Credential Issuance Procedure
procedures.description: Risk-based process for issuing temporary credentials to vendor/contractor maintenance personnel for one-time or time-limited access
procedures.rationale: Discussion states organizations may issue temporary credentials to manufacturers, consultants, vendors based on risk assessments

executionEvidence.name: Authorized Maintenance Personnel List
executionEvidence.description: Current list showing: individual names, organization/vendor affiliation, authorization level, technical competencies, clearance/background check status, authorization date, expiration date, contact information
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (b) explicitly requires maintaining a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel; must be current for access decisions

executionEvidence.name: Maintenance Personnel Authorization Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: personnel name, organization, authorization request date, background check results, technical competency verification, access level granted, approver name/title, authorization date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (a) requires authorization process; records demonstrate systematic authorization of maintenance personnel

executionEvidence.name: Pre-Maintenance Access Verification Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: maintenance personnel name, date of maintenance, systems to be accessed, required authorizations checklist, verification method, verification result (pass/fail), verifier signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (c) requires verification of non-escorted personnel authorizations before maintenance

executionEvidence.name: Escorted Maintenance Supervision Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: supervised maintenance date, personnel supervised, supervisor name/qualifications, supervisor authorization level, technical competence justification, supervision duration, activities monitored
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement (d) requires designation of qualified supervisors; records demonstrate supervision of personnel lacking full authorizations

executionEvidence.name: Temporary Credential Issuance Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: vendor/contractor name, risk assessment results, temporary credential type, access scope/limitations, valid dates (start/end), credential revocation date, issuer authorization
executionEvidence.rationale: Discussion notes temporary credentials may be issued based on risk assessments for one-time or limited time access

executionEvidence.name: Quarterly Authorized Personnel List Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: complete personnel list reviewed, inactive personnel removed, authorizations revalidated, expired credentials identified, technical competencies verified, reviewer signatures, review completion date
executionEvidence.rationale: Maintenance personnel authorizations require periodic revalidation; quarterly review aligns with access review best practices

executionEvidence.name: Maintenance Activity Logs
executionEvidence.description: Logs showing: maintenance personnel name, organization/vendor, date of maintenance, systems accessed, maintenance performed, escorted/non-escorted status, supervisor (if applicable), maintenance duration
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides audit trail linking maintenance activities to authorized personnel and verification of authorization process compliance

operationalActivities: Process authorization requests for new maintenance personnel
Conduct background checks and verify technical competencies
Add authorized maintenance personnel to approved list with expiration dates
Verify access authorizations before granting non-escorted maintenance access
Designate qualified supervisors for maintenance personnel lacking full authorizations
Assign escorts with appropriate technical competence and authorizations
Issue temporary credentials to vendors/contractors based on risk assessment
Log all maintenance activities with personnel identification
Conduct quarterly reviews of authorized maintenance personnel list
Remove inactive, expired, or no-longer-needed maintenance personnel from authorized list
Revoke temporary credentials immediately after maintenance completion or expiration
